titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn 26th Ward improvement report for New Jersey Avenue 1987.008
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-09-17 20:05:24 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn 26th Ward improvement report for New Jersey Avenue
did.abstract: A single bound volume, dated 1891, that consists of a report on the paving, curbing, and guttering of New Jersey Avenue between Atlantic Avenue and Jamaica Avenue in Brooklyn.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Brooklyn 26th Ward improvement report for New Jersey Avenue, 1891, 1987.008; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A single bound volume, dated 1891, that consists of a report on the paving, curbing, and guttering of New Jersey Avenue between Atlantic Avenue and Jamaica Avenue in Brooklyn, as well as details as to how the cost was shared between the relevant landowners. The volume is leatherbound and hand-lettered in ink on its cover, and the interior pages are a mix of printed and handwritten material.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
